changes: Added compatibility ratings (Do note that these are only from Xenia Stable's game compatibility repository and might not be the most trustworthy, but should give you rough idea how the game works)

Game shortcuts now use Xenia Manager's launch arguments which should make them more flexible (In other words, as long as you don't move Xenia Manager or delete the game from Xenia Manager, they should work)
Implemented "max_settings_profiles" setting in Xenia Settings
Updated some URLs (This is because I'm deleting current repository where this stuff is stored)
Fixed launching the games via launch parameters (Small typo in the code)
Replaced Andy Decarli's source with the Launchbox Database for game information
Game boxart editing now supports .ico files
Added the ability to download and edit game icons for shortcuts via the "Edit Game Info" window (Might require PC reboot or icon cache reset because of Windows)
Added support for launching games via launch arguments (e.g., Xenia Manager.exe "game title")

Added option to download title updates from XboxUnity (Requires Game ID and Media ID. If you added the game before 1.11 you want to re-add the game in Xenia Manager so it properly reads Game ID and Media ID otherwise you won't be able to use this)
Moved selection of locally available title updates and content to the "Install Content" window ("Explorer" Icon)
Added settings for "Widescreen," "Allow Invalid Fetch Constants," "Use Fuzzy Alpha Epsilon," and "Query Occlusion Fake Sample Count" (Reordered some existing settings)
Images will now be resized correctly instead of being filled with black borders (Re-add games for this to take effect)
Changed "Api Address" setting to a dropdown menu with previous addresses used in Xenia Netplay, now allowing manual editing of the selected address
Added "Copy Settings" button (This will be used to copy all of the current settings from the appropriate default configuration file to the selected game's configuration file)
Added option to Switch to Custom Xenia build (You lose some features when you do this, might add support for them in the future)
Added "Open Repository" button to the Main Window
Added Text To Speech support to the UI (Tested with Windows Narrator)
Improved image URL validation (Now it ensures that the URL serves an image rather than just checking if the URL is functional)
Xenia Manager won't ignore games that have same game title, it will just act like Windows (add a number at the end of game title)
Added a prompt when deleting games, asking users if they also want to delete the game's content folder (if it exists)
Added reading of MediaID for games (For future purpose)
Fixed a bug that caused Xenia Manager to not launch when no configuration file was found (A mistake I made when making Xenia Manager remember if it was in Fullscreen mode or Windowed mode)

Implemented Fullscreen mode (Thanks to @jaylex32 for giving me an idea for it. I used his fork to implement it here). Once you go Fullscreen and close the app, the app will then launch back into the Fullscreen mode again (This also works for Windowed mode)
Adjusted the UI so it fits the Fullscreen mode better while staying relatively the same in Windowed mode aside from some UI tweaks
Added 'All Licenses' option to the 'License Mask' setting (This is only useful in rare cases such as Modern Warfare 3 DLCs where only this option can make them appear)

Fixed a bug when adding games via 'Xbox Marketplace' source (Noticed that some games have multiple entries in this list of games (example The Wolf Among Us) and they have different ID's so now it will also match the search result with gameid)
Now Xenia Manager will properly wait for config.json to be read from the file into Xenia Manager itself before continuing with the startup
Fixed an error with NVAPI where it wasn't properly dealing with 'NVAPI not being supported' (Noticed this bug when I was testing Xenia Manager in Linux under Wine)
Now when exporting save files, it will also include the "Header" folder (Without it, games like GTA 5 won't load the saves)

This is the first build built using Github Actions instead of it being built on my PC (Noticed that builds built using Github Actions are half the size so decided to use it for stable builds. Haven't had issues so far, but I'm expecting feedback).
Added support for 'Netplay' builds (Currently it only downloads the latest stable release, but maybe in the future I'll change it to download latest version from Github Actions)
Added ScrollBars to the UI so it's easier to scroll without a mouse
Implemented a backup solution for detecting game id and title using 'xenia.log'
Removed 'XeniaSelector' option since it became obsolete

In 'XeniaSettings' you can now find all of the emulator configuration files before actual game configuration files in the ComboBox (Also added a note detailing how it works. TLDR: Emulator profiles are only used to generate game specific configuration files and they get overridden when launching games.)
Made NVIDIA Driver specific settings show up on all profiles instead of just the emulator profiles
Removed some unused stuff from the configuration file (It will update once you change something like change a theme, but it's not strictly necessary. If you have issues, try 'Reset Configuration')
Added 'Add Additional Patches' option to the ContextMenu of games (This is useful when you have multiple patch files and want to use both of them)

Fixed first search when adding games to the Xenia Manager when searching by game id and then title (Previously it would sometimes not wait for searching to finish, causing it to think there were no games found)
Fixed some bugs in the installation/uninstallation process (Example: Now it's using absolute path instead of relative when deleting the directory of the emulator)
Added 'Edit Game Info' window that is used to rename the game and replace it's icon with a custom one (has to be .jpg, .jpeg or .png format)
Users can now select different versions of Xenia directly from 'EditGameInfo' window, moving this option from the ContextMenu
Fixed an issue related to adding games like 'Split\Second', where backslashes would disrupt configurations
Replaced RadioButtons with a ComboBox for selecting sources in the 'AddGame' window
Added a new source 'Xbox Marketplace' (This should be the best source for adding games)
Improved loading of sources in the 'AddGame' window
Implemented draggable functionality for all windows
Adjusted the title text of the 'WelcomeDialog' (Now when launched from 'Xenia Manager Settings' it will say 'Install/Uninstall Xenia')
Fixed ProgressBar foreground color (Now it'll switch properly based on theme selected)
Now user can multiselect multiple games when adding them
When adding the game, if it's not found in the lists of games, it'll prompt user if he wants to use the default game icon or if he wants to search for the game himself in the lists of games

Added new options to the context menu ('Install Content' and 'Show Installed Content') and removed some old options ('Import Save File', 'Export Save File' and 'Install Title Update'). 'Install Content' option expands on 'Install Title Update' option by allowing user to also install things like DLC, while 'Show Installed Content' option allows the user to import and export save files and delete installed content (DLC's, Title Updates, etc.)
Now after clicking the 'Update' button, it will open the release it will update to so the user can see what has changed
Added a button 'Changelog' that will open a window which will show all changelog from 1.0.0 to the current latest version
Reorganized the 'Settings' page for Xenia Manager. (Now all buttons are in 1 line, instead of being separate)
Reordered the ContextMenu for games
When adding games, game title will be stripped of special characters (Example: '™' found in Batman Arkham Origins)
Added the option to change game language ('user_language' option)
Fixed 'Internal Display Resolution' option not showing
Fix vertical scrolling through Library
Added function to uninstall Xenia Stable & Canary
Cleaned up Library code, specifically code related to loading games into the UI (Now it should be easier to add additional features like Netplay build)
Fixed a bug with searching for games when adding them that would make some games not be recognized due to formatting
Added a check and backup options for Andy Decarli's icon grabbing
Use relative instead of absolute paths in the configuration file
Added a 'Reset Configuration' button that will try to fix the configuration file of Xenia Manager
Added a new Dark theme while the old one was renamed to AMOLED
Swapped the non checked and checked colors in AMOLED, Dark and Nord theme
Fixed a bug where Video Settings wouldn't get disabled if they're not in the configuration file
Added 'Nord' theme
Added an option to open the selected configuration file in a default text editor (backup option is notepad in case the first one breaks)
Cleaned up tooltips and context menu text
Fixed 'internal_display_resolution' not being shown
Added 'Open Compatibility Page' option
Improved searching when adding games to Xenia Manager
If the game isn't found in the lists when adding it, it'll use default disc icon
Fixed rounded edges of the game images
Added caching of WPF Pages (This fixes a memory leak and keeps the RAM usage to ~150MB after every WPF Page is opened)
Added title updates support (Xenia Canary ONLY)
Added theoption for switching emulator version the game use
Code cleanup
Fixed downloading game patches. Now they will properly install in Xenia Canary patches folder
Now game patches properly get assigned their location to their respective games
Theme support (Currently Light and Dark/AMOLED)
Add Xenia Stable support
Add option to import and export save files
Now it takes one click instead of two clicks to select a game in SelectGame window
Can't add games multiple times
If you have both Xenia versions you can choose which one the game will use
Fixed NVIDIA Framerate Limiter text not showing if the value was set to 0
Added settings for D3D12 and Vulkan
Added some hacky settings for specific games that might need them
Add Input System Option
Enable/Disable VSync through NVIDIA Drivers
Added an icon
Added NVIDIA Framerate Limiter option
